Reweighted L1 minimization function that uses an homotopy continuation method to approximate the L0 norm. It solves at each iteration the following problem::

where is the sparsifying operator, is the diagonal weight matrix, is the measurement operator, is a noise tolerance, is the measurement vector and is a diagonal weight matrix that changes at every iteration. The solution is denoted .

Note:
The solver can be used to solve the analysis based problem, as written, or the synthesis based problem by mapping and , where is the identity matrix.
Parameters:
[in,out]xsolSolution ( ). It stores the initial solution, which should be set as an input to the function, and it is modified when the finall solution is found.
[in]nxDimension of the signal ( ).
[in]APointer to the measurement operator .
[in]A_dataData structure associated to measurement operator .
[in]AtPointer to the adjoint of the measurement operator .
[in]At_dataData structure associated to the adjoint of the measurement operator .
[in]PsiPointer to the synthesis sparsity operator .
[in]Psi_dataData structure associated to the synthesis sparsity operator .
[in]PsitPointer to the analysis sparsity operator .
[in]Psit_dataData structure associated to the analysis sparisty operator .
[in]nrDimension of the signal in the representation domain ( ).
[in]yMeasurement vector ( ).
[in]nyDimension of measurement vector, i.e. number of measurements ( ).
[in]paraml1Data structure with the parameters for the L1 solver (including ).
[in]paramrwl1Data structure with the parameters for the reweighted L1 solver.

Reweighted L1 minimization function that uses an homotopy continuation method to approximate the L0 norm. It solves at each iteration the following problem::

where is the sparsifying operator, is the diagonal weight matrix, is the measurement operator, is a noise tolerance, is the measurement vector and is a diagonal weight matrix that changes at every iteration. The solution is denoted .

Note:
It uses the sdmm algorithm to solve the weighted L1 problem. The solver can be used to solve the analysis based problem, as written, or the synthesis based problem by mapping and , where is the identity matrix.
Parameters:
[in,out]xsolSolution ( ). It stores the initial solution, which should be set as an input to the function, and it is modified when the finall solution is found.
[in]nxDimension of the signal ( ).
[in]APointer to the measurement operator .
[in]A_dataData structure associated to measurement operator .
[in]AtPointer to the adjoint of the measurement operator .
[in]At_dataData structure associated to the adjoint of the measurement operator .
[in]PsiPointer to the synthesis sparsity operator .
[in]Psi_dataData structure associated to the synthesis sparsity operator .
[in]PsitPointer to the analysis sparsity operator .
[in]Psit_dataData structure associated to the analysis sparisty operator .
[in]nrDimension of the signal in the representation domain ( ).
[in]yMeasurement vector ( ).
[in]nyDimension of measurement vector, i.e. number of measurements ( ).
[in]paraml1Data structure with the parameters for the L1 solver (including ).
[in]paramrwl1Data structure with the parameters for the reweighted L1 solver.

This function solves the problem:

where is the sparsifying operator, is the diagonal weight matrix, is the measurement operator, is a noise tolerance and is the measurement vector. The solution is denoted . It uses the Simultaneous Direction Method of Multipliers (SDMM) to solve the optimization problem.

Note:
The solver can be used to solve the analysis based problem, as written, or the synthesis based problem by mapping and , where is the identity matrix.
Parameters:
[in,out]xsolSolution ( ). It stores the initial solution, which should be set as an input to the function, and it is modified when the finall solution is found.
[in]nxDimension of the signal ( ).
[in]APointer to the measurement operator .
[in]A_dataData structure associated to measurement operator .
[in]AtPointer to the adjoint of the measurement operator .
[in]At_dataData structure associated to the adjoint of the measurement operator .
[in]PsiPointer to the synthesis sparsity operator .
[in]Psi_dataData structure associated to the synthesis sparsity operator .
[in]PsitPointer to the analysis sparsity operator .
[in]Psit_dataData structure associated to the analysis sparisty operator .
[in]nrDimension of the signal in the representation domain ( ).
[in]yMeasurement vector ( ).
[in]nyDimension of measurement vector, i.e. number of measurements ( ).
[in]weightsWeights for the weighted L1 problem. Vector storing the main diagonal of .
[in]paramData structure with the parameters of the optimization (including ).
